decks.notes: The deck revolves around using the commander Oloro, Ageless Ascetic to gain incremental life advantage while setting up a combo win condition with the card Doomsday. The deck includes a variety of control and card draw spells to protect the combo pieces and dig through the deck efficiently. By utilizing tutors like Demonic Tutor and Grim Tutor, as well as card draw engines like Dark Confidant and Phyrexian Arena, the deck aims to quickly assemble the necessary pieces for the Doomsday combo. The deck also includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Counterspell to interact with the opponent's game plan and ensure a clear path to victory through the combo.

The key strategy of this deck is to control the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption. The commander, Zur the Enchanter, allows for powerful enchantments to be searched for and put into play, providing additional control options. The deck includes a variety of versatile spells such as board wipes, targeted removal, and card draw to maintain control over the game. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistency and access to multiple colors. By disrupting opponents' strategies, removing threats, and out-valuing them with card advantage, this deck aims to dominate the game and emerge victorious in a one-on-one duel.

This deck revolves around utilizing Derevi, Empyrial Tactician as a commander to create a fast-paced aggro strategy. The key concept is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures, disruptive spells, and powerful equipment. By utilizing mana dorks like Elvish Mystic and Noble Hierarch, the deck aims to ramp into powerful threats like Geist of Saint Traft, Tarmogoyf, and True-Name Nemesis. Additionally, Derevi's ability to untap lands and creatures can be used to generate extra value from cards like Gaea's Cradle and Sylvan Library. The inclusion of cards like Sower of Temptation and Sword of Feast and Famine adds versatility and power to the deck, allowing for multiple avenues of attack and defense.

The main concept of this deck is to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy while utilizing Thassa, God of the Sea as the commander for added aggression. With a focus on countering spells, bouncing threats, and stealing key enchantments, the deck aims to maintain board presence and tempo advantage. The inclusion of various disruptive spells like Cryptic Command, Mana Leak, and Force of Will, along with creatures like True-Name Nemesis and Snapcaster Mage, helps maintain control of the game while setting up for a powerful finish with creatures like Master of Waves and Grand Architect. Additionally, the deck includes a variety of card draw and manipulation spells to ensure consistency and access to key cards.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using Derevi, Empyrial Tactician as the commander. The deck focuses on a mix of efficient creatures and powerful spells to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. By utilizing a variety of mana-producing lands and mana dorks, the deck aims to ramp up quickly and play threats ahead of schedule. Additionally, the deck includes powerful cards like Birthing Pod, Swords to Plowshares, and Jace, the Mind Sculptor for added versatility and card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to apply early pressure, maintain tempo, and close out games before the opponent can stabilize.

The focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of powerful removal spells, board wipes, and hand disruption, while using Skithiryx, the Blight Dragon as the win condition. By utilizing a high number of Swamps and various mana rocks, the deck aims to ramp quickly into its commander to close out games with infect damage. The inclusion of cards like Nevinyrral's Disk, Karn Liberated, and Oblivion Stone provides additional board control options, while hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Duress help disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck's strategy revolves around grinding out value and overwhelming the opponent with powerful threats and disruption.

The deck focuses on utilizing a variety of spells and creatures to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategies while setting up powerful combos with The Mimeoplasm. It includes a mix of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to maintain control of the game. The deck also incorporates reanimation spells to bring back powerful creatures from the graveyard and take advantage of their abilities. Show and Tell and Flash are used to cheat big threats into play, while cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead can be used to bring back key creatures. The mana base is carefully crafted to ensure the deck has access to all the necessary colors of mana to cast its spells effectively.

The deck aims to control the game by disrupting the opponent's spells and board presence while drawing cards and removing threats. It includes a mix of counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption to keep the opponent off balance. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana of the Veil to generate card advantage and control the battlefield. Additionally, the deck has a strong mana base to ensure it can cast its spells consistently. Overall, the strategy revolves around outlasting the opponent, disrupting their game plan, and eventually winning through attrition or with powerful threats like Nicol Bolas, Planeswalker.
